alert.note: Alert for Gallia (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 26 at 6:53AM EST until February 28 at 10:36AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Charleston WV has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Ohio...West Virginia... Ohio River At Point Pleasant affecting Gallia and Mason Counties. For the Ohio River...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ohio River At Point Pleasant. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 41.0 feet, The Addison, Blaville Road in Ohio is flooded and low lying areas surrounding Point Pleasant and vicinity are flooded due to backwater. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM EST Saturday the stage was 38.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 41.0 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 40.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 41.0 feet on 02/07/1903. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rlx. The next statement will be issued this evening at 700 PM EST.
